main.name: Ivy Initiation
main.description: Complete these tasks across campus to earn your Tiger stripes.
steps: Visit Richardson Auditorium.
Snap a photo with a tiger statue.
Visit the Princeton Football Stadium.

main.name: Revolutionary Remembrance
main.description: Honor Princeton’s place in American history.
steps: Visit the Princeton Battlefield State Park.
Find the Mercer Oak Monument.
Read the historical plaque near the battlefield cannon.

main.name: Nassau Navigator
main.description: Explore the most iconic buildings on campus.
steps: Visit Nassau Hall.
Walk past East Pyne Hall.
Take a look at Blair Arch.

side.name: Caffeinated Campus Life
side.description: Get a drink from Small World Coffee.

side.name: Boba Beast
side.description: College towns are known for their boba. Princeton is no exception!
steps: Get a drink from Kung Fu Tea.
Get a drink from MTea.
Get a drink from Junbi.
Get a drink from Fresh O Tea.

side.name: Colonial Main Street
side.description: Walk along Nassau Street and soak in the colonial charm.

side.name: Quiet by the Quarry
side.description: Sit by the fountain at Palmer Square and enjoy the atmosphere.

side.name: Bridge Over Calm Waters
side.description: Walk across the bridge near Carnegie Lake.

side.name: Art Outside the Frame
side.description: Explore the outdoor sculptures near the Princeton University Art Museum.

side.name: Banners of Black and Orange
side.description: Spot an orange-and-black Princeton banner hanging in town.

side.name: Pages and Patrons
side.description: Snap a photo of the Princeton Public Library on Witherspoon Street.

side.name: Tigers on Guard
side.description: Find a tiger statue around Princeton and take a selfie with it.

side.name: Snack Stop
side.description: Buy a snack from a local deli or café.

main.name: Empire Essentials
main.description: See New York from its most iconic places.
steps: Visit the Empire State Building.
Walk through Times Square.
Ride the NYC subway.

main.name: History in the Heights
main.description: Explore NYC's cultural and revolutionary past.
steps: Walk past Alexander Hamilton’s grave at Trinity Church.
Visit the National Museum of the American Indian.
Stand at Battery Park and look toward the Statue of Liberty.

main.name: Park Pioneer
main.description: Reconnect with nature in the big city.
steps: Enter Central Park from the south entrance.
Find the Bethesda Fountain.
Relax on a bench near Sheep Meadow.

side.name: Pizza Pursuit
side.description: Get a classic slice of New York-style pizza.

side.name: Rooftop Recharge
side.description: Visit a rooftop location with a skyline view.

side.name: Library Lookout
side.description: Find the stone lions in front of the NY Public Library.

side.name: Museum Hopper
side.description: Take a photo outside the Metropolitan Museum of Art.

side.name: Subway Selfie
side.description: Snap a selfie while waiting for the train.

side.name: Skyline Sketch
side.description: Draw or sketch any part of the NYC skyline.
